title: Life in New York
message:
Renee,
You told me once that you want to move to a big city, because you love the unpredictability and chaos that comes with it. But I know youâ€™re hesitant, partly because your parents donâ€™t want you too far away. And I get it! youâ€™ve always wanted to be a good daughter. But that doesnâ€™t mean you have to put your own dreams on hold. You deserve to live the life you want, not the one anyone else picked for you. So go chase that city energy. If you miss home, fly back, visit more, make it work. It might take a bit more time and effort to travel from New York to Huntsville, but itâ€™s worth it if youâ€™re living a story thatâ€™s actually yours. Bring the warmth back with you when you do.

title: Cybersecurity Dream
message:
Renee,
Nobodyâ€™s got it all figured outâ€”weâ€™re all just kind of winging it. I know youâ€™ve been curious about cybersecurity, and honestly, Iâ€™d love to see you dive into it.
You told me once how your major wasnâ€™t really your thing, and I remember thinking, â€œShe deserves better than just okay.â€ Whether itâ€™s tech, music, or something totally random, I just hope you chase what actually lights you up.
And heyâ€”knowing that you kind of want to learn programming because of me? Thatâ€™s probably the best compliment Iâ€™ve gotten all year. So seriously, hit me up for a coding lesson anytime.
Forget expectationsâ€”youâ€™re way too cool to follow someone elseâ€™s blueprint.

title: Rock On
message:
Renee,
I still remember your mom proudly showing me videos of you playing piano and violin on stage. But I get itâ€”you lost interest after being pushed too hard.
And yet, you still light up when you talk about learning guitar or drums.
That right there? Thatâ€™s the spark.
I can totally picture you jamming out after classâ€”or even on a small stage somewhere, repping your favorite band tee and just doing your thing.
Do it for you this time. Loud. Messy. Free. Thatâ€™s where the fun lives.

title: Liberty Wind
message:
Renee,
You remember that windy cruise in New York, right? You were so busy holding your bangs in place that you almost missed the skyline. And Iâ€™m being serious when I said I liked your forehead ğŸ˜†
Honestly though? That was one of my favorite moments. Because even when youâ€™re caught off guard, you shine.
So next time, let your hair fly. Be in the moment. Youâ€™re already beautifulâ€”probably more than you give yourself credit for.

title: Speak Up, Sweetheart
description: Youâ€™re allowed to want the original Coke. And a nap.
message:
Renee,
Twice. You ordered an original Coke and got Diet Coke instead, and both times you just smiled and said â€œItâ€™s fineâ€ before I could even say anything.
And donâ€™t even get me started on when you said you were sleepy, but still went along with the group like, â€œYep! Totally awake!â€ ğŸ˜…
Youâ€™ve got this huge heart, and I admire that. But you donâ€™t have to say yes to everything just to keep the peace. Your voice matters too. You deserve to get exactly what you wantâ€”whether itâ€™s the right drink or just a break when youâ€™re tired.
â€”Leo
